answerText: "Blow-up" [accept "Las babas del diablo" or "The Devil's Drool"][10] "Blow-up" was written by this author of "Axolotl" who also wrote a novel about Horacio Oliveira with 99 "expendable" chapters, titled Hopscotch.
heading: Penn Bowl |2013 | 9 | 17 | Literature | World | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: The narration of this story switches between a first-person narrator, Michel, and Michel talking about himself in the third-person. [10] Name this story in which Michel thinks he saw a boy who was about to have sex with a hooker, but instead realizes that he saw that boy just before he got robbed.
